title: A Study of the conflicts of the female main character in George Moore's Esther Waters
abstract: This study is about George Hoore, Esther yaters. In this studyt the writer discusses the internal and external confllcts of the main character, and also hop she handles those conflicts. The main character, Esther Maters, is struggling within herself and against other people surrounding her, since she is pregnant and has an illegitimate child. The topic is interesting to discuss because Esther's life is a picture of a woman who has to rear her illegitimate child by herself. The main purpose of this study, is to shou the conflicts of the main eharacter, Esther Maters, both internal and external conflicts. Besides, the writer also wants to know how the main character overeomes those eonfliets which are not easy to face. In analysing the main character's conflicts, the way to overcome her conflicts, the writer uses data from the novel Esther @aters, uhich is supported by the literary theory of conflicts and some literary criticism of the author and his work. at last, from the analysis of the conflicts, the writer finds out that Esther as the female main character, can stand in facing confliets. She can overcome her conflicts by her eare for others, her love for her child, and also because of her faith in God.
contributors: Josefa Juniarti Mardijono (Advisor 1); Liliek Soelistyo (Examination Committee 1); Stefanus Suprayitno (Advisor 2)
subjects: ENGLISH POETRY-19TH CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING; MOORE, GEORGE, 1672-1729. ESTHER WATERS-STUDY AND TEACHING
